column4: someone help me fix this error, Err http://archive.ubuntu.com feisty/universe Packages  Sub-process gzip returned an error code (1)
or tell me where aptitude saves package.gz files
you'd have to show the entire error, that's not enough. Put it on a pastebin
http://pastebin.ca/733523
any ideas?
that's really odd that an ubuntu repo would do that. Could be a corrupt download. You've tried more than once, I hope (not)?
yes
do u have any ideas where aptitude saves package.gz files it download
security is the only one that does that? If so, it's probably a problem at the other end
works fine on another system i have
/var/lib/apt/lists
see.. now deleting everything there fixes it
I'll remember that, thanks for the update
try searching for pages with Flash in the names on help.ubuntu.com/community , there are some troubleshooting pages ghere
trying that :)
btw know the fix for no usplash on boot ?
I turned off usplash, I really like the scrolling kernel messages (not, fglrx breaks consoles with framebuffers)
only by installed size , not by installer size :)
actually, it has installed size and size, could probably format the output and pipe it through sort.
it does o.O
i tried alsa, oss and aoss for firefoxrc [flash] :( still no sounds.. any ideas?
no, I've been very lucky with linux and sound. Never had any problems
